questiontext.text:
Below is a regression equation of a moderation model. The dependent variable “PINC” is personal monthly income (net, in euros). “MAN” is a dummy variable (female = 0; male =1); “FULLTIME” is a dummy variable indicating whether a person works 32 hours or more (score 1) or less than 32 hours of paid work per week (score 0).

PINC = 1381 + 644*MAN + 742*FULLTIME - 128*FULLTIME.

Suppose we want to test whether the moderation effect (idem: interaction effect) of MAN on the relationship between FULLTIME and PINC is significant. What should we do then?

generalfeedback.text:
Language Dutch

Levels of Difficulty Easy

M&T Basics of quantitative research Basics of quantitative research

M&T BIS Default value

answer.text: We must then verify that the difference between the value 644 and the value -128 is significantly different from 0.
We must then check whether the difference between the value 742 and the value 644 deviates significantly from 0.
We must then verify that the difference between the value 742 and the value -128 is significantly different from 0.
We should then check whether the value -128 is significantly different from 0.
We must then check whether the value 742 is significantly different from 0.
